intro: Centropogon longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its long, slender stems and showy blooms make it a distinctive species within its native range. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
